name: Chari
headline: B2B e-commerce and fintech platform for traditional proximity stores
description:
Chari is an e-commerce and fintech app for traditional retailers in French-Speaking Africa allowing them to order any consumer goods they sell and get delivered for free in less than 24 hours. 
Chari is also a financial services provider for these retailers, offering them microloans
.

founders.name: Ismael Belkhayat, Founder
founders.description:
Moroccan born & raised. 
Went to a french High School in Rabat Morocco, then left Morocco to go to University in Europe and the US.  I studied and lived in Paris, London, Madrid and Ithaca. 
I started my career working as a consultant for the Boston Consulting Group and then left after 3 years to become a tech entrepreneur in Casablanca Morocco.

founders.name: Sophia Alj, Founder
founders.description:
I am a tech entrepreneur, co-founder & COO of Chari.co.
I am an ex-McKinsey consultant with a passion for digital transformations. 
I am the mom of 2: Malyk & Leyla, 3 and 2 years old.
I am a triathlete & skydiver.

generated_description:
Chari is a B2B e-commerce and fintech platform that cleverly serves traditional proximity stores in French-speaking Africa. Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator Batch S21, this dynamic startup is headquartered in Casablanca, Morocco, and employs around 100 people. Its mission is straightforward: empower local retailers by making the supply chain simpler and more accessible.

Imagine being a corner store owner—your store is the heart of the neighborhood, but getting stock can be a logistical nightmare. Enter Chari. Through its intuitive mobile app, retailers can order anything they sell, and get those goods delivered for free within 24 hours. If that wasn't enough, Chari also provides essential financial services, including microloans to help these businesses thrive.

Chari's interface is designed for ease of use, allowing clients to order a variety of consumer goods at competitive prices with just a few clicks—no more long waits or complicated logistics. Plus, thanks to a payment establishment license from the Central Bank of Morocco, they can offer integrated financial services like payments and micro-insurance, broadening the scope of support for its users.

As of now, Chari boasts over 25,000 customers, and its platform features an expansive catalog of more than 1,200 products. User testimonials sing praises about how Chari has streamlined their operations. They appreciate the clarity in pricing, the range of products, and the responsive customer service.

Leadership at Chari includes Ismael Belkhayat as CEO, alongside a robust executive team, showcasing a mix of talent that reflects their growth ambitions. With the backing of investors who act as catalysts for their vision, Chari is charting a course for disruption in the retail supply chain conundrum of the region.

If you're interested in learning more or exploring their services, check out their website: [Chari](https://chari.com).
